S.FORM: tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun a ken i gaku.
S.TRANSL: 我今天七點到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: patagilj anga, kitulu mangetjez anga ti sinsi qivu ti pangcang, “gacalji! drequngi!”
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: pasi qaca men a qivu, “nanguanguaq sun sinsi.”
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: tazua nu kitulutulu, tuluan a amen ni sinsi ta pinayuanan a sasupuan.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the paiwan language of numbers.

S.FORM: kiciur a men ta sinsi a semupu, semenay a men ta sasupuan a senay.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: liyaw a ku kinitulu ta kay a pinayuanan.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many paiwan languages.

S.FORM: ljemita ta qadaw a ken a sema gaku, ljemita ta qadaw a ken a itulu tua pinayuanan, uri ikay a ken a palangeda tjaikina.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the paiwan language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: ti camak a u ngadan.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是camak。
My name is camak.

S.FORM: ti sakinu a ngadan na ku kama.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是sakinu。
My dad’s name is sakinu.

S.FORM: ti kivi a ngadan na ku kina.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是kivi。
My mother’s name is kivi.

S.FORM: tapuluq anga ku cavilj tucu.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: izua macidilj a ku kaka tjavulung a uqaljay, ti piya timadju, tapuluq sa ita anga cavilj nimadju.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫piya，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is piya, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: kitulutulu amen i tua mamaw a gakku.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: tjengelay aken kati kaka tjavulung a uqaljay a semenay.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: tjengelay aken a ljemangui nu kalja pulavayan maciur a men a tacemekeljan a vaik a ljemanguy.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: tjengelay aken a kipuqali ta vaquan a qali, maqati amen a maciur a semenay katua ljemanguy.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: aljak a ken na paiwan.
S.TRANSL: 我是排灣族的小孩。
I am an paiwan child.

S.FORM: a nia kinaizuanan a tjumaq i tainan.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在台南。
Our family lives in tainan.

S.FORM: malje lima men a taqumaqanan.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: i tua nia taqumaqanan matjelu a men a mare siruvetjek.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: na kitevelj aken tjai kama kina kaka tjavulung a uqaljay kata vavayan.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: qacaqaca a ku kama, a ku kama. taizing.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: mariljay a ku kina, a ku kina. kuisang.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: nu i tjumaq ti kama penayuwanan nu ikai tja nu amen.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the paiwan language with us at home.

S.FORM: nu kalja pulavayan vaik a men a maqinaljan.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: maciyur aken kata ku kaka tjavulung a djemameq ta qubequb.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: tjengelay aken aravac ta niamen a cemkemkelj.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: tucu a qadaw vaik aken kati kina ma casaw a kivangavang.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: cangiyangiya ravac a kalevelevan nu maqadadaw inika ljaljeqel inika maculju sarenguaq a vali.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: keman amen ta minpaw i tjai vavaw ta cemel maqadaw a kinacavacavan sarenguaq angata.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: nu pasuvililj tu cengelj mapavalit anga kalevelevan ta qudjidjilj.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: ku kivadaqan ti kina aku qudjidjilj a quljaw na kalevelevan.
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: qivu ti kina tjara uri mangetjez anga a buhu aya.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: neka nu qerepus i kalevelevan nu qezemezemetj minqut anga vitjuqan.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: uri tjumaq anga men uta.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: ka tjumaumaq aken i djalan iqaung aken ta vitjuqan.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: ulja inika na mangetjez a buhu, saljinga ken ta vaik a kivangavang.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: a ku gakku i ljaqedi ta niamen a umaq djemavac aken a ljemitaqadaw a magakku djemavac aken uta sematjumaq.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: inika kudral a nia gakku inika tjuruvu a situ na makakeljang amen a mapuljat.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: matevetevelj a kakedryan i undudju meseljang a kivangavang a maljavar.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: kiseljang uta tiasinsi tjanuamen a kivangavang a gakku namaya ta qaca a tacemekeljan.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: parimasudj amen a ljemita qadaw sa tja ljenguaqi a parimasudj a tja kakituluan.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: izua vaik a zemuking ta qezung izua vaik a semuap.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: parimasudj amen tua putuputung i kgakku na marasurasutj amen a mapuljat a gakku na maparimasutj a ljemita tu qadaw.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: tatiyaw na vaik aken a paljilji tjai vuvu a uqaljay.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: cuacuai anga men a inika mecevung singlit aravac aken tjaimadju.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: kapacun ti vuvu a uqaljay tjanuaken pakanan aken ta kudamunu sa patekelan aken ta utja.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: qaljemeqem a sinitalem a kudamunu ni vuvu a uqaljay sanguaq angata.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: tjengelay aken uta ta uciya ni vuvu nu tekelen bulay angata.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

S.FORM: nu vecekadan tu qadaw meseljang aken kati vuvu a vavayan a kemesa tua nia cengel.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: kemesa ti vuvu tu liyaw angata cengelj izua ciqaw kuka siyak izua luli uta.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: kana kincengel anga men vaik amen a mapuljacengan a kiljaceng.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: liyaw a kini vurasi vasa rukiya ni vuvu tu sipakacu tjanuaken a tjumaq.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: kipusau aken tjayamadju kivalanga ken nu tjaivililj uta ku ayain a ikai.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

S.FORM: kinacu amen ni sinsi a ma kakataliduan ta qemuziquzip i paljing amen a na siyugu a uri veneli ta kipu.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: ka ljetaladj amen ta kakataliduan ta qemuziquzip kikai ti sinsi, “a i qayaw qayaqayam a i tjai likuz qatjuvi kacidicidilju a talidu a mapuljat.” aya ti sinsi.
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: marekutj aken ta qatjuvi saka ini aken a pacun ta kana qatjuvi.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: liyaw a ku pinacunan a qayaqayam a minlayalayap ita kasiw a pacacikecikel pacun aken uta ta ljequ a na taqed i taladj ta lala na kasiw.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: izua zu izua rigi kata likuljaw ita kakataliduan ta qemuziquzip maleva ken ta ku pinacunan tucu a qadaw.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: liyaw a sasing a ku sinasing tu sipapacun tjai kina kati kama.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: nutjaivililj uri kicaciyuran tjai kama kati kina a mangtjez.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: tucu ka pulavalavai vaik aken kata ku kaka tjavulung a vavayan a ma taitu a paljilji tjai kama i kuliw.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔kuliw。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle, kuliw.

S.FORM: na maka kisiya men a kemasi taihuku a ma taitu.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: tjemalju a men i taitu unting ti kama i kuliw ta palidring a mangetjez a kicacevung tjanuamen.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: ini ka cadja ta tapaw ni kama kuliw a hucecan ununting ta palidring palamu djemaljun.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle’s house, and it’s just a short drive away.

S.FORM: izua tjaljeqacaqaca a pugungngan idungdung ta tapaw ni kama kuliw meseljang amen a kididingsiya mapugungan.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle’s house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: i pugungngan kacuin amen ni kama kuliw a pakan ta gung kata rigi.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵牛和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: ka qezemezemetj meseljang amen a sema lizuk a keman.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: liyaw a palidring i lizuk saka na kiutubai amen a mazua.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: ka uri vaik ta zua pacunan tu cinakau anga utubai maka basu anga men a vaik.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: tucu i taihuku anga men qadjau kimadjumak anga utubai ni kama kuliw.
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道kuliw叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don’t know if my uncle’s motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: kakakedriyan aken i kuskus a niatapaw kapatagilj anga ken a magakku patjavat anga matawing i lizulizuk a nia sikacu.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在高士，上學以後，就搬到了桃園，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in kuskus. After I started school, we moved to Taoyuan and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: ka madaigaku anga ken kitulu aken ta kinacalisiyan a bungka sa ku keljang anga ta i taiwan a kacalisiyan izua ngaquaqn namakakaizua a bunka.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: manasika tucu a cavilj nu kaljapulavayan uri vaik aken kati kaka tjavulung a uqaljai a paljilji ta ramaljemaljeng a uri kiljaljuai ta nimitja a kemacidiljan a bunka.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: alu anga puluq a cavilj na ramaljemaljeng ljakua nu tja pacunan namaya ta inika vuluvulung.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: ku kivadaq timadju pida su kinacaqu a kai macaqu aravac a ikai ta pinaiwanan saigu uta ikai ta na tjukuku zipun kilang a kai.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的排灣語說得很流利，也會說中文、客家話和日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in paiwan, as well as Chinese, Hakka and Japanese.

S.FORM: ka kivadaq anga ken tjaimadju kemeljang anga aken tu na kemasi kakedriyan kitulu ta zipun a kai a valjaw nimadju pairang i tua karakudakudain nimadju tjuruvu a kineljang a kilang manasika liyaw a kinacaqu a kai.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是平地人，而他工作上認識許多客家人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Chinese, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: tazua kakiqaqivuavuan amen liyaw a sini pasemalaw a pakatua qemaljup a saiguan kata kakudan.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: kumalji inika liyaw a niakeljange ljakua nia pinaka tua dinguwa a paiga maqati a gemalju kiljaluai a kilangeda.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: kakakedryan aken neka nu ku kemeljang tua ku bunka masiyaq aken a maciljilj ta ku kinacalisiyanan.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: nu cuai anga nu tjaliau a kineljangan paka pakisumalji a kinanguaq kinabulai sedjalep a sikizengel a kinapaiwanan.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為排灣族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Paiwan is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: tucu a qadaw nu masulem uri mangetjez anga ku kaka tjaljaljak a uqaljai.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: vaik aken kati vuvu a vavayan a semavavelian a veneli ta djurikuku tu sipadjulu a kemesa ta sanguanguaq a kaiven tu sipakan ta ku kaka tjaljaljak a uqaljai.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: cemalivat amen ta vaveliyan liyaw a vaquan a ljaceng.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: na veneli amen ta ingcai qaqilj kata daikung.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: qivu azua i ljaqedi a paveliveli ta kudamunu a tauki, “qaljemeqem aku panguralj kata qudis pai veliu tu kedri aya!”
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: na veneli amen ta panguralj kata qudis.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: kacemalivat amen ta vavelian ta vutjulj, qivu a tauki, “anema su velin? tucu a qadaw a kuka kakudralj sa qaluman nu ita tjeluaidai.”
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: paka pazangal ti vuvu a vavayan kivadaqan a tauki maqati a menadjulu a paveli.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: ljakua qivu a tauki minamadjulu anga inika maqati a paljateku ta kakavelian.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: a i ljaqedi a tauki qivu ta idu veliu ta ku ciqaw kudralj saka madjulu.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: kacuai anga veneli anga men ta kuka kata ciqaw tjumaq sa kemesa tu tja nu ita cekui a djamai.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: anga kaljava masulem anga kalevelevan.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: na palingas aku kaka tjaljaljak a uqaljai na papintjus a ikai ta ini anga maqati a pulavai a puhitayan nu tjaivililj a niciubi maqati anga tjumaq.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: ikai ti vuvu a vavayan liyaw anga kinsa qaqivu a mapuljat ta kemanan!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

S.FORM: na tjemaulj amen ta mareka nia kasusu qali ta meseljang a kaiv.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: izua ku qali a ti kuliw timadju ru maraurau a kemacu ta nemanga.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個朋友叫kuliw，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named kuliw, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: nu kitulutulu kisedjam ta salasaladja tua sivecivecik siquliqulip kata vavecikan a qadupu.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: nu puita pudrusa putjelu pasedjaman timadju na zuma.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: ljakua izua za inika bulai a kakudanan nimadju ru kisedjam sa ini a nga pacikel.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: nu cuai anga inika nga pasedjam tjaimadju.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: izua ka ita qadaw vaik amen a mapuljat a kivangavang.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: kaidjalan lingau ti kuliw ta sama kaya ljakua na maraurau a kemacu ta sidjuadjuas.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，kuliw想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, kuliw wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: kisedjam timadju ta cilikami tua salasaladj ljakua tevelain tjaimadju namaya ken uta a inika na kemacu.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: qemaung ta latjakan ti kuliw madjalw sa ikaikai aqumaya inika ken a nu pasedjaman ta cilikami aya.
S.TRANSL: kuliw急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!
kuliw burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: pasemalavan na salasaladj timadju, ayatua inika sun a kemacu nu kisedjam sun inika su pacekel!
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: katiyau anga tu qadaw na medjama ti kuliw a magakku pacikelen a kinisedjam a nemanga na salasaladj.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，kuliw很早就到學校了，kuliw把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, kuliw arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: kipaqaljai ta salasaladj ti kuliw ikai, ta tjara kemacu anga nu tjaivililj ta nemanga timadju masalu uta ta salasaladj ta na selaing a pasedjam ta nemanga tjaimadju.
S.TRANSL: kuliw向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
kuliw apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: a ku kama ru qaljuqaljup i qinaljap.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: ka kakedriyan aken nu uri vaik a qemaljup nu qezemezemetj ti kama kati kama i kuliw kemacu ta tjakidi kata kuang.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔kuliw會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: nu maljiya mangtjez a na kemacu ta qinaljup tiamadju.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: izua nu vavui izua nu lava izua nu patavatan uta.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: i ta sidjaljunan a qinaljan pangaljen niamadju ta sikataqaljan azua qinaljup a sacemel.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: tjara makavaljai aken sakamaya tjai kama a vaik a qemaljup.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: ikai ti kama nu meqacanga ken kacuin anga sun aya.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: saigu uta puringai ta sidjameqan ta sacemel a i qinaljan a uqaljaqaljai saigu tiamadju a semanaya ta pareqel kata kadringayan a ringai.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: saigu aravac a semanaya ta pareqei a ringai ti kama ikai ti kama aicu sidjamedjameq ta patjavatan tja kigagaljuin a pacun a pinakazuan a tjekap na sacemel tjapizuain i tua pinakazuan a djalan na sacemel a ringai.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: ayatua sika maqatiyan a djaljaw a kiseljang ta ramaljeng a qemaljup kicaquan aken a ljemita qadaw ta puringai a ku ringai djaljaw a paqulid sa djemameq ta sacemel.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: kapacun ti kama tja nu aken ikai ta nu tjaivililj tjara tjalja saiguan anga sun aya.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: maqacuvucuvung anga ken tucu kemavuc aken ta ku panaq kata vakela a kiseljang tjai kama a vaik a qemaljup.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: nu cemikel a maqinaljan azua qinaljup a sacemel siseljiva tua taqaljaqaljan a caucau.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: ikai ti kama maleva itjen ta tja sevalitan a na papumanguaqan sa izua mapeljuq a tja sacemel a qinaljup.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: na sekavililj anga en a sema gaku ka kadjaman.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: na dremaudraw aen, masi kabang a semagaku.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: neka nu anema a u kinacu.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn’t bring anything with me.

S.FORM: matevelj amen, a pacun tua sapitj a kitulutulu.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: nu sekiseking, pasedjaman aen tua sivecivecik katua siquliqulip nua u salasaladj.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: aitucuin aen ni sinsi, “nu tjayvililj udamau anga migacalj, mayanga sekavililj!”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, “Wake up earlier next time and don’t be late again!”

S.FORM: ti Kuliu a u kaqaliyan, aljak nua sePaiwan uta timadju.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Kuliu，他也是排灣族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is Kuliu, and he is also an Paiwan child.

S.FORM: maciyuciyur amen a kitulu i Tjaqaciljay a qinaljan.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在Tjaqaciljay部落讀書。
We study together in the Tjaqaciljay tribe.

S.FORM: ru kilangda men tua vuluvulung a menilimilingan, macaqu amen aravac a penaiwanan.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說排灣語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Paiwan proficiently.

S.FORM: qaca tu kural aen, kedri tu mariljay ti Kuliu.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Kuliu很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Kuliu is short and thin.

S.FORM: tarivak aravac ti Kuliu, tjenglay amen a mapuljat taymadju.
S.TRANSL: Kuliu很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Kuliu is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: malalumalj tua undu nua gaku kasuni a qadaw masanliyaw aravac a sipalalumalj a undu.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: izua mavavijvilj tua calis, tjemadrek tua buru, mintuluq, zemiyan katua penanaq.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: malalumalj ta mintuluq a masaniyaen.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: na sekulilj aen ka mintuluq aen, na pedjamuq tu qaca ravac a u cungal.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: ljakua migacalj aen, sa getjem a minntuluq a pasaqayaw.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: ka djemaljun aen tua pautezan, maleva aravac a timaimanga caucau.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: ljaki inika en a malap tua sangasangasan, ngadan na maleva en aravac, ayatua u qinacuvung a lalumaljen.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: na vaik amen kati ama kivala tjay ama i Sakinu.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔(sakinu)。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: na mapasaqetju a kula ni ama i Sakinu.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔(sakinu)的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: tjinumaljan amen tu na maberung tu ita berung a qaljiyu.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: ka ljemelaljelay timadju tua qaliyu na matjani a kemasi tua qaljiyu.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: na kemacu ti ama tua vutjulj a gung katua saviki tu sipavay tjay ama i Sakinu.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔(sakinu)。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: masudju amen i qumaqan kati ama i Sakinu, pinaseljavakan aen tu liyaw a milimilingan.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔(sakinu)在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: ka uri vaik anag en ， kemazala ti ama i Sakinu tu na meqaca ngaen, tu tja vangsar anagen.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔(sakinu)誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: u ayain tiama i Sakinu: "" nu menguaq anga su kula, pangtjezu anga matjanuamen a kivala。”
S.TRANSL: come to our house next time and visit us.""
I said, When your foot gets better

S.FORM: ka2022a cavilj, na pakaigi a sihu tu maqati anga vecikan a mibunsiu tu na sekacalisiyan a ngadan.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: u kinivala sa kivadaqi azua cuacuay anga kiqaqav tua sihu tu vecikan a mibusiu tua “na kacalisiyan a ngadan'' a i qinaljan a ti Kuliu a maqacuvucuvung.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Kuliu。
I interviewed Kuliu, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: niapinenetj tucu sisekezan a qadaw tu uri kivalain a semata tjumaq nimadju.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: ka maljavaljavar amen pinasemalavan aen tua kinasizuan nua ngadan nimadju, pinakeljangan aen tua sikatacemkeljan katua nimadju a qinaljan.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: “akumaya gemtjem sakamaya tu mumalj tua ngadan, manu nakuya sipavecikan a sicuayan?'' u ayain a kivadaq.
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: aitucuin aen nimadju, “ayatua a ciniukukan a vecik inika sedjameq tua kaqulidan a ngadan nimadju, a qaliqali “ku siyenseng” ayanan nu qemaqivu tjaymadju”, liyaw ana masan djeli a kay.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Ku Xian Sheng

S.FORM: ati Kuliu qivu, “a veciken tu na kinacalisiyan a ngadan, kanimitjan angata ngadan. a u ngadan avan nu na sevalit tua nimitja tjarakacalisilisiyan, nimitja cemekeljan, na saljinga itjen tu madjumak a kanimadjuan a ngadan.”
S.TRANSL: our family
Kuliu said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: na vaik amen kati vuvau a vavayan i papaveliyan a zematjak tua racev, na kemacu tu liyaw a sinitalem a ljaceng, sa sanayai tua na kinacaliiyan a kakanen sa paseljavakan tua caucau a mapuljat.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: tjenglay a mapuljat tua zinatjakan ni vuvu a vavayan, tjuruvu a veneli tua kamangulj katua ljaqacay, tjuruvu uta mangtjez a keman tua sinadjamay nimadju.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: sanguaq aravac a kinsa nimadju a kuniyaw katua djuadjuay a tjinaljek, djinaung tua aradj a vutjulj nua vavay, madjaulj a tjuruvu a qaljaqalja tua sequan, matjatjavilivilj a caucau matua nia zinatjakan.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的芋頭乾粉滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: nu kemesakesa ti vuvu a vavayan, i gidi aen a djemaudjaulj tua qaljaqalja. tjarautjautjau aen i gidi a, “niyamen a sinitalem a ljaceng, na meqca i gadu, pay kirimu a mangtjez a veneli u!”
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: palamu mapuljt a sepaveli a nia racev, maytucu ti vuvu a vavayan, “ayatua ulja izua sun na pusaladj lja.”
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

S.FORM: aicu sengsengan, na matulu anagen tua na cemelanga katua kakanen a kakeljangan, autauta seljavak anga en tua luljayan nua zematjak a paveli.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: pacun aen tua tjenglayan nivuvu a vavayan ta sicuayan a kakanen, na miyazuan saka mapungadan a u vinarungan.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
